textDari: هر چه کنی به خود کنی گر همه نیک و بد کنی
textPashto: هر څه چې کوې، په ځان یې کوې، که ښه وي که بد
translationEn: Whatever you do, good or bad, you do it to yourself.

textDari: آب که از سر گذشت چه یک وجب چه صد وجب
textPashto: اوبه چې له سره تیرې شوې، که یوه نې که سل نې
translationEn: When the water passes over your head, it doesn’t matter if it's one inch or a hundred.
meaning: Once the situation is out of control, the degree doesn't matter.

textDari: از تو حرکت از خدا برکت
textPashto: له تا حرکت، له خدا برکت
translationEn: You make the move, God brings the blessings.

textPashto: بې زحمته خزانه نه ترلاسه کېږي
meaning: Nothing valuable can be achieved without effort.

textDari: هر که بامش بیش برفش بیشتر
textPashto: چا چې بام لوړ وي، واوره به یې هم زیاته وي
translationEn: The higher the roof, the more snow it gathers.
meaning: With greater wealth or status comes more responsibility or trouble.
One small sign doesn't indicate a bigger change.

translationEn: The tailor fell into the jar.
meaning: Someone fell victim to their own tricks or work

translationEn: Hearts have a path to each other.
meaning: There is an unspoken connection between people.

translationEn: Not every round thing is a walnut.
meaning: Not everything that looks the same is the same.

textDari: چراغی که به خانه رواست به مسجد حرام است
textPashto: چراغ چې کور ته روا وي، جومات ته حرام دی
translationEn: A lamp needed at home is forbidden to be taken to the mosque.
meaning: Charity begins at home; take care of your own first.

textDari: اگر خواهی نشوی رسوا همرنگ جماعت شو
textPashto: که نه غواړې رسوا شې، د خلکو په رنګ رنګ شه
translationEn: If you don't want to be disgraced, blend in with the crowd.
meaning: Sometimes it's safer to follow the crowd.
